articles.author: Timour Azhari, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel bombarded the Gaza Strip and Beirut's southern suburbs on Friday, a day after U.S. envoys made a renewed but so far fruitless diplomatic push to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Iran-backed groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel pounds Lebanon, Gaza after U.S. truce push

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea flexed its military muscle with the test of a huge new solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missile dubbed Hwasong-19, state media said on Friday, amid international uproar over its troops deployed to aid Russia in Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea says record test was new Hwasong-19 intercontinental ballistic missile

articles.author: Joseph Tanfani, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Some U.S. states are warning local officials not to intervene illegally or refuse to certify results.
articles.title: Trump's fraud claims revive fears he may again seek to overturn election results

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: U.S. data and polling firm Edison Research said on Friday the differences between its exit poll of Georgia's parliamentary election and the official results pointed to "manipulation" of the vote, becoming the second such pollster to do so.
articles.title: US pollster Edison says Georgia election results suggest 'manipulation'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched more than 2,000 attack drones at civilian and military targets across Ukraine last month, Kyiv's military said on Friday, as Kremlin forces press a grinding offensive on the front line of their February 2022 invasion.
articles.title: Russia attacked Ukraine with more than 2,000 drones in October, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Friday that Russia was monitoring the ongoing presidential election in Moldova, but was not interfering in it despite a flurry of allegations from the West and Moldova's pro-Western president to the contrary.
articles.title: Russia is monitoring Moldova's elections but is not interfering in them, says Kremlin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Botswana's ruling BDP party lost its parliamentary majority in this week's election, the private Mmegi newspaper and state radio reported on Friday, citing results from over half the constituencies.
articles.title: Botswana's BDP party loses power in election, local media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean Foreign Minister Choe Son Hui, in a Moscow meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, accused the United States and South Korea of plotting a nuclear strike against her country.
articles.title: North Korea's Choe accuses US and South Korea of plotting a nuclear strike against her country

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: The needs are growing, temperatures are dropping, and supplies are getting tight.
articles.title: In east Lebanon, looming winter hints at stretched aid response

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel carried out air strikes early on Friday on Beirut's southern suburbs, Reuters witnesses said, the first strikes there in nearly a week.
articles.title: Israel hits Beirut's southern suburbs for first time in days, Reuters witnesses say
